conclusion: Identify forces acting on the system to find tension magnitudes in ropes OP, OA, and OB.
Object A has mass m_A = 5 kg and weight W_A = 50 N; tension in rope OA is T_OA.
Object B has mass m_B = 10 kg and weight W_B = 100 N; tension in rope OB is T_OB.
Rope OP makes an angle of 45° with the vertical.
Tension in rope OP is T_OP.
At point O, forces must balance since the system is in equilibrium.
Vertical component of T_OP must balance the weight of object A: T_OP sin 45° = T_OA.
Horizontal component of T_OP must balance the tension in rope OB: T_OP cos 45° = T_OB.
Tension in rope OA (T_OA) supports the weight of object A: T_OA = W_A = 50 N.
Using the vertical component, solve for T_OP: T_OP = 50√2 N ≈ 70.71 N.
Using the horizontal component, solve for T_OB: T_OB = 50 N.
Final answer: Tension in rope OP is approximately 70.71 N, tension in rope OA is 50 N, tension in rope OB is 50 N.
